FuncDef:
The nat-policy template command configures a NAT policy template.
The undo nat-policy template command deletes a configured NAT policy template.
By default, no NAT policy template is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a NAT policy template.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Using the NAT policy template, you can configure a threshold for the sessions of a user and the port pre-allocation range.
When a user is being authenticated, the RADIUS server delivers the name of the NAT policy template to the device. The MPU delivers the maximum numbers of assignable NAT sessions and ports defined in the template to service boards.
Precautions
The device supports a maximum of eight NAT policy templates.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The nat-policy template command is applicable only to VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
